title: History Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of historical events, figures, and periods.

questions.question: In which year did World War I begin?
questions.explanation: World War I began on July 28, 1914, and lasted until November 11, 1918.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first President of the United States from 1789 to 1797.

questions.question: The ancient city of Rome was built on how many hills?
questions.explanation: Rome was built on seven hills: Aventine, Caelian, Capitoline, Esquiline, Palatine, Quirinal, and Viminal.

questions.question: Which civilization built the Machu Picchu complex in Peru?
questions.explanation: Machu Picchu was built by the Inca Empire in the 15th century and is now one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize?
questions.explanation: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, winning the Physics Prize in 1903 and the Chemistry Prize in 1911.

questions.question: The French Revolution began in which year?
questions.explanation: The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille on July 14.

questions.question: Which empire was ruled by Genghis Khan?
questions.explanation: Genghis Khan founded and ruled the Mongol Empire, which became the largest contiguous land empire in history.

questions.question: The Renaissance period began in which country?
questions.explanation: The Renaissance began in Italy in the 14th century before spreading to the rest of Europe.

questions.question: Which document, signed in 1215, is considered one of the most important documents in the development of constitutional government?
questions.explanation: The Magna Carta, signed by King John of England in 1215, established the principle that everyone, including the king, was subject to the law.

questions.question: Which ancient wonder was located in Alexandria, Egypt?
questions.explanation: The Lighthouse of Alexandria, also known as the Pharos, was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and was located in Alexandria, Egypt.
